INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's port is not open for this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Port Not Open - SSH

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are known to CounterACT as the default credentials for this device using this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Factory Default Credentials - SSH

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Factory Default, Communication Protocol:SSH

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are included in the custom credential list for this protocol in CounterACT Options > IoT Posture Assessment Engine.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Custom Credentials - SSH

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Custom List, Communication Protocol:SSH

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are known to CounterACT as commonly used credentials that are likely to be compromised during a brute-force attack using this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Commonly Used Credentials - SSH

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Commonly Used, Communication Protocol:SSH

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials using this protocol are not known to CounterACT.
INNER_RULE.NAME: No Known Credential - SSH
Port Not Open OR Active Inspection Blocked

CONDITION.LABEL: URL Content Password:*******, Filter:*UNUSED*, Ignore failed script result:false, Kerberos Domain:*UNUSED*, Scrub HTML:true, User:admin, URL:http://{ip}/view/viewer_index.shtml, Extra curl options:--max-time 5 --negotiate --anyauth -L -k

VALUE.VALUE2: Live view

CONDITION.LABEL: URL Content Password:*******, Filter:*UNUSED*, Ignore failed script result:false, Kerberos Domain:*UNUSED*, Scrub HTML:true, User:admin, URL:http://{ip}/view/viewer_index.shtml, Extra curl options:--max-time 5 --negotiate --anyauth -L -k

VALUE.VALUE2: Live view

INNER_RULE.NAME: Incorrect Credential In Use - Possible Rogue Device

CONDITION.LABEL: URL Content Password:*******, Filter:*UNUSED*, Ignore failed script result:false, Kerberos Domain:*UNUSED*, Scrub HTML:true, User:admin, URL:http://{ip}/view/viewer_index.shtml, Extra curl options:--max-time 5 --negotiate --anyauth -L -k

VALUE.VALUE2: 401 Unauthorized

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's port is not open for this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Port Not Open -SNMP

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are included in the custom credential list for this protocol in CounterACT Options > IoT Posture Assessment Engine.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Custom Credentials - SNMP

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Custom List, Communication Protocol:SNMP

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are known to CounterACT as commonly used credentials that are likely to be compromised during a brute-force attack using this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Commonly Used Credentials - SNMP

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Commonly Used, Communication Protocol:SNMP
Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:No, Login Credentials:Factory Default, Communication Protocol:SNMP

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials using this protocol are not known to CounterACT.
INNER_RULE.NAME: No Known Credential - SNMP

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's port is not open for this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Port Not Open - Telnet

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are known to CounterACT as the default credentials for this device using this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Factory Default Credentials - Telnet

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Factory Default, Communication Protocol:Telnet

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are included in the custom credential list for this protocol in CounterACT Options > IoT Posture Assessment Engine.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Custom Credentials - Telnet

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Custom List, Communication Protocol:Telnet

INNER_RULE.DESCRIPTION: This sub-rule matches if the device's login credentials are known to CounterACT as commonly used credentials that are likely to be compromised during a brute-force attack using this protocol.
INNER_RULE.NAME: Commonly Used Credentials - Telnet

CONDITION.LABEL: Credential Vulnerability Save Login Credentials in Host Log?:Yes, Login Credentials:Commonly Used, Communication Protocol:Telnet
